Singapore Geospatial Challenge

Business Analytics Mania 2016

University Town | 3rd - 4th September

[Some scroll-down glyph of sorts]

Singapore GeoSpatial Challange Business Analytics Mania (SGCBAM) is a nationwide competition which aims to introduce the use of Data Analytics tools for business organisations to students, giving them an opportunity to learn business analytics tools to move Singapore towards becoming a Smart Nation.
SGCBAM is open to Pre-University Students. Students from the same instituition form a team of 3 students. A mentor will be attached to the team throughout the competition.

This year's challenge will focus on geospatial demographics analysis to make business decisions on where to set up the next food trend shop.
Teams will be given a set of raw data and use Business Analytic tool (SAS) to visualise the data and generate business insights.

SGCBAM 2016 is a 2-day (9am - 6pm) competition from 3rd to 4th September 2016.
Teams will learn, hack and present their analysis during the competition.
